title: Slaughterhouse-Five: Too Disturbing for Students
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Slaughterhouse-Five: Too Disturbing for Students.

hook.text: Kurt Vonnegut watched a school board burn his anti-war novel. He wrote them the most polite, devastating letter ever.

buildup.text: Slaughterhouse-Five was based on Vonnegut's experience as a POW during the firebombing of Dresden.

discovery.text: A North Dakota school board burned 32 copies in 1973 â€” calling it 'depraved, immoral, and mentally sick.'

twist.text: Vonnegut wrote to the board chairman: 'You should also resolve to suppress my book, which is a very funny book.'

climax.text: The novel continues to be challenged, but it's taught in universities as one of the greatest anti-war books ever.

punchline.text: They burned his book about burning. He saw the irony.

quiz.question: What real event is Slaughterhouse-Five based on?
